Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, slightly ribbed on the interior, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 68
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393181) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393181)
